content: The Act titled "Securing America's Energy Independence Act of 2007" extends and modifies the investment tax credit for solar energy property and qualified fuel cell property. The Act "Securing America's Energy Independence Act of 2007" extends and modifies the investment tax credit for solar energy property and qualified fuel cell property. Amendments include changing the years from 2008 to 2017 for solar energy property and from 2007 to 2016 for fuel cell property. Additionally, energy property now includes excess energy storage devices. The Act "Securing America's Energy Independence Act of 2007" extends and modifies the investment tax credit for solar energy property and qualified fuel cell property. Amendments include changing the years from 2008 to 2017 for solar energy property and from 2007 to 2016 for fuel cell property. Energy property now includes excess energy storage devices. Solar lighting equipment and solar photovoltaic energy property credits are also addressed in the amendments. The Act extends the investment tax credit for solar energy property and qualified fuel cell property until 2017. It includes credits for solar lighting equipment and solar photovoltaic energy property, with a special rule for a $1,500 credit for each half kilowatt of capacity placed in service during the taxable year. The amendments to the Internal Revenue Code include changes to specified credits and the investment credit under section 46(2). The effective date for these amendments is January 1, 2007. The amendments made by this section will be effective on January 1, 2007, while the changes in subsection (c) will apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2006. Extension and modification of credit for residential energy efficient property. Extension and modification of the residential energy efficient property credit include amending the termination date to 2016, removing the 30 percent allowance for solar electric property, and setting maximum credits for solar electric and water heating properties. The residential energy efficient property credit is extended and modified, with changes including setting maximum credits for solar electric and water heating properties. Definitions for qualified solar water heating and photovoltaic property expenditures are also amended. The credit is allowed against alternative minimum tax. SEC. 4. 3-YEAR ACCELERATED DEPRECIATION PERIOD FOR SOLAR ENERGY PROPERTY AND FUEL CELL PROPERTY. The text discusses amendments to the Internal Revenue Code related to property descriptions for tax purposes. It includes changes to section 168(e)(3) and section 48(a)(3)(A) to specify certain types of properties eligible for tax benefits. The amendments made by this section apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2006.
